attributes.action: Raise the minimum age for social media accounts to 16 In the UK
attributes.additional_details: Social media is linked to rising rates of anxiety, depression, poor sleep, and harmful content exposure in children. Under-16s are especially vulnerable. Other countries, including Australia, are introducing stricter laws to protect children online. The UK must act now to prioritise child safety over corporate profit.
attributes.background: Introduce a law to raise the minimum age for social media accounts to 16. Require platforms to use robust age verification to enforce this and protect young people’s mental health, wellbeing, and safety online.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Ban social media for under-16s to protect children
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/710283
